abstract: The earnings were partly the result of higher cable bills for 72 percent of Comcast’s subscribers.
snippet: The earnings were partly the result of higher cable bills for 72 percent of Comcast’s subscribers.
lead_paragraph: Despite a slowdown in the number of customers paying for cable and high-speed Internet subscriptions, Comcast reported a 17.4 percent increase in net income, to $1.44 billion, in the three months that ended March 31.

headline.main: Higher Cable Bills Help Comcast Increase Profit by 17%
headline.print_headline: Higher Cable Bills Help Comcast Increase Profit by 17%
